intro: Raddia guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese raddia, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, often with a faint fragrance. Raddia guianensis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
